benchmark_details.name: STARE (Spatial Transformations and Reasoning Evaluation)
benchmark_details.overview: STARE is a benchmark designed to rigorously evaluate multimodal large language models on tasks better solved through multi-step visual simulation, featuring approximately 4,000 tasks in geometric transformations, integrated spatial reasoning, and real-world spatial reasoning.
similar_benchmarks: CLEVR (Diagnostic Dataset for Compositional Language and Elementary Visual Reasoning)

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To evaluate multimodal models' abilities in spatial cognition and visual reasoning, focusing on tasks that humans solve non-linguistically through visual simulation.

data.source: Programmatically generated synthetic tasks focusing on visual reasoning and simulation.

methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated by evaluating model performance against the generated tasks and human benchmarks.
methodology.interpretation: Higher accuracy indicates better performance on complex spatial reasoning tasks.
methodology.baseline_results: Human performance serves as the baseline for comparison.
methodology.validation: Extensive experiments and error analyses were performed to validate the benchmark.
